website_summaries.verdict: While it offers Britax's reliable safety features at a nice price, the fit may not work for tiny infants or hefty youngsters.
pros: Versatile option that offers 14 adjustable positions – from baby to toddler years
Offers the brand's impressive ClickTight installation system and superior safety features
cons: Straps are somewhat challenging to adjust, especially when securing chubby babies
Straps can be loose for very small newborns

customer_reviews.title: Seatbelt frayed to a thread within 3 weeks of purchase
customer_reviews.text: Buckling my baby in after only three weeks of using this brand new seat, thank god I noticed the seat belt had frayed to basically a single thread at the very bottom of the belt where it connects to the seat. I don’t know if this is a fluke with just the seat I bought or some defect that might recur in other seats, either way it’s absolutely life threatening in the case of a crash. I returned it through amazon but will contact Britax with photos and video because this is absolutely shockingly dangerous. Photo attached.
customer_reviews.author: pickypicky

customer_reviews.title: Downgraded from 4 stars after a year of use
customer_reviews.text: 2017 Changed from 4 stars to 1 after 1 year of use This model is a nightmare. It is poorly mad and unsafe.The belt component and its clips on this particular model used to attach to the latch hooks are just aweful. I almost got a hernia over the last year whenever I attempted to loosen the belt to take the car seat out of my car. Now, three weeks after 1 year warranty expired, car seat is literally coming apart (see photos). We have 4 Britax car seats-but this one is total junk.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Clark

customer_reviews.title: Misleading info on rear facing!
customer_reviews.text: Need to call manufacturer. It says it can be rear facing 5-40 lbs which is why we bought it. The instruction manual says the same, then the sticker on the car seat says : warning, danger or death if higher then 20 lbs is rear facing and not to do it. Of course this after we threw away our previous car seat and unpacked and installed this one. It also is a pretty snug fit leg room-wise for our 20 lb son rear facing.
customer_reviews.author: Christianne

customer_reviews.title: Horrible! Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: It cuts into my kids legs, as the crotch button is way too short, the click tight button is cheaply made and I question the safety of it, it’s so bulky but actually really small. It sucks!!! My older son has a Recaro Pro ride and it is amazing, even 4 years later...wish I would have stuck with that. 😡
customer_reviews.author: ChubbyCheckers

customer_reviews.title: Made all the difference!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 month old hated his infant car seat, so we decided to try a convertible to see if it would help us stay sane on car rides. Needless to say, this carseat is now his "throne". We feel like this was the safest option for our little one, and upon arriving we thought is was the most well built car seat we'd ever seen. That being said, I do have two issues. One, the leg straps are incredibly tight. Two, it's pretty difficult to unbuckle the crotch buckle to get them out. It's taken some time to figure it out, and it's still difficult. Regardless, thanks Britax for making awesome and safe "thrones" for our babies!
customer_reviews.author: Judah

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe & Poor Customer service
customer_reviews.text: This carseat has been nothing but frustrating since we purchased it. It's not safe. The belts don't pull at the same rate causing one to be loose and the other to be tight. We frequently have to take out child out and adjust the straps. And don't bother with online customer support filing it automatically closes your tickets. And the phone support isn't much more helpful than that.
customer_reviews.author: jen

customer_reviews.title: Saved my son's life.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second seat, we were in an accident that resulted in totaling our brand new car and my son didn't even have a scratch. Not one bruise he didn't cry and wasn't even scared. So of course we bought another. The color of the seat is actually really nice and the material is nice as well it was a bit different then his first seat. We love the ease of install. My son also loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissi

customer_reviews.title: Regretting my decision to purchase
customer_reviews.text: This car seat has been nothing but trouble. The harness is uneven and after several calls with customer service to troubleshoot and a new harness, it’s still not even or safe for my child. His neck is constantly red from where one side rubs and the bottom straps are twisted and I can’t get them undone. To top it off after a milk spill, I discovered the bottom pad isn’t removable so it’s destined to smell like sour milk. Trying a different brand this time.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Will Not Install Correctly Because It Needs a Pool Noodle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this car seat because it would install at a more reclined position like an infant car seat. The instructions say to install it with a pool noodle. This makes the car seat move around way too much and not level leaving the child to be lopsided in the seat. This is very disappointing considering the price point of this car seat. You also can not contact the company for any help after 5 and on weekends. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kerce

customer_reviews.title: This seat sucks
customer_reviews.text: This car seat sucks. Its huge, we have a vw Atlas and it is so big it goes over the seatbelt latch for the seat next to it, the straps are super annoying to buckle, i hate it! AND the customer service person was a jerk! Return window is closed and Britax won’t take it back. Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.author: jordan

customer_reviews.title: Cannot adjust as child grows; something is jammed related to shoulder harness and we cannot lengthen
customer_reviews.text: Our grand daughter has only used the car seat twice. We purchased in June 2018. She is only 2 years old and we realized that the next time she visits we will need to lengthen the harness to give her more room. The click and release does not work. We cannot lengthen the harness strap. We have communicated with the company and they have not given us any information on how to clear the jam. It appears the straps are inaccessible to the size of a hand. Expensive car seat for not being able to use. The company knows we have an issue but does not respond back.
customer_reviews.author: PDH

customer_reviews.title: Safe and feels substantial
customer_reviews.text: We had some issues with the straps when we first purchased and had to talk to Britax customer service to correct. Overall a great seat. Fits better in our VW atlas then it did in our Subaru cross treck or outback. Straps are easy to buckle, but sometimes unevenly loose (my biggest complaint about the seat). Son is comfortable and has been using since about 7 months - is 16 months now. Easy to clean and get in and out of car. Like the material on this version. We have a different seat as our back up and I much prefer this steel frame, it feels substantial and safe. I would order this again for a future child.
customer_reviews.author: mjm0216

customer_reviews.title: I will buy nothing but Britax carseats
customer_reviews.text: Besides the fact that this is one of the safest if not the safest car seat on the market, its also incredibly easy to use and put into my car. I have used these as a nanny and now use them as a mother. Yes it is a big car seat. Yes it is heavy. And yes it is expensive. But my child's life is more important than any of those factors. I love this car seat. END OF STORY
customer_reviews.author: Tmccullough

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I have had issues from day one with this seat. It does not tighten smoothly which I have dealt with. However, today I discovered the styrofoam material under the head/back support has splitnin half. This is completely unsafe and I will need a new seat and have not even had this for a year. I should be refunded or sent a new seat! We have the same seat in my husnbands vehicle with no issues but the one for my car has issues. I don't know if I have a lemon or what but this needs to be resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Ford

customer_reviews.title: Get ready to scream expletives
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to actually put my child in this seat because it is incredibly difficult to install. Spent half an hour reading the manual, testing harness, etc. Then went to install in a rear-facing setup using the latch system. I pulled with all my might, bruising my hands, still slack in the strap, seat still moves around with little effort. Closed the click-tight system just to see if that would make the seat more snug/stable. Now it won't open again and the seat is stuck. Can't readjust, can't take it out. Probably will have to cut it out. Horrible experience
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Straps wont tighten evenly.
customer_reviews.text: The shoulder straps dont tighten evenly. One remains unsafely loose and the other too tight. Something gets caught inside. To fix it you have to fully loosen and pull both straps and they tighten them all the way without your child in the chair. It is maddening. I bought a britax marathon and those straps work like a dream. Wish I had never bought this seat. Its unsafe for anyone else to use with my child because its impossible to know when the straps will and wont work.
customer_reviews.author: Fun shoes

customer_reviews.title: It came flawed. The inner part where there is ...
customer_reviews.text: It came flawed. The inner part where there is a plug that should fit into the lock/unlock hole, was torn. See pics.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: All 3 of mine literally fell apart!
customer_reviews.text: Got this seat based upon safety ratings but this is seat isn’t even close to safe! I’ve now had THREE separate Britax marathon seats that have literally fallen apart at the sides. The two plastic side pieces are supposed to be connected and each seat they’ve initially come connected but within months, one or both sides become loose. I’ve called and emailed britax each time, sending them photos, and they’ve agreed it was a safety concern and replaced the seats. Great customer service but I’m absolutely terrified to continue using this seat since the same thing continues to happen to each seat.
customer_reviews.author: Mama, RN

customer_reviews.title: OBSESSED. BUY IT ALREADY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been a Chicco fan my son's entire life and although I still love them, I purchased my two 2 picks for a convertible carseat when my son upgraded: the Chicco Nextfit and Britax Boulevard Clicktight. All I can say is that I'm sold on the Boulevard. It's well made, absolutely beautiful, easiest installation ever and the harness is easier to adjust compared to the Nextfit. Could not be happier!! Will probably be buying another one too!!
customer_reviews.author: Ehimmelman

customer_reviews.title: Annoying installation and problems with straps
customer_reviews.text: This car seat was rated most safe in 2019, which is why I got it. The safety features are good, but installation isn’t. It’s way too easy to get the straps caught under the seat when you’re slamming it down. And one of the straps is irreparably twisted — I’ll have to get it checked again by a police officer and hope they can fix it. And one of the straps is always looser than the other one. I like that we don’t have to worry about the latch system, but that’s about all I like about it.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne M. Leo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing car seat!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing car seat, so easy to put in, and once it’s in it’s super tight and safe. It is very heavy, which I know some people have complained about and their reviews, but let’s be serious a lightweight plastic car seat is in no way going to be a safe is a heavier duty metal frame car seat . So do you want the convenience of light weight or do you want safety for your child. It is not safe to take a car seat in and out of cars to swap back-and-forth anyways. I would recommend this car seat all day long!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer r  brown.

customer_reviews.title: Great car seat but how would you clean the “cool flow” fabric cover?
customer_reviews.text: We already have one Britax Boulevard and love it. It’s a great seat. When we went to purchase a second one I saw this new “cool flow” fabric which in theory is a great idea. My kiddo gets warm in his current seat so I thought I would give it a try. But it’s basically a big mesh pattern with two layers and you can only hand wash it... my first thought was what will happen when he inevitably spills on this? Everything will get caught between the two layers of fabric... it will be a nightmare to clean. It’s going back in exchange for the same seat but different fabric.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: I live Britax but I hate this carseat.......
customer_reviews.text: I have four kids and all of them have been in Britax carseat. They have always been well made and easy to use. I just purchased this carseat for my youngest child. It seems to be be the same quality but I hate the new latch system buckles. Instead of the latches with the red release buttons, Britax has gone to those black lobster claw looking hooks. They are very hard to loosen so that you cannot remove the carseat easily. It's such a pain. I am so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: cdwickli

customer_reviews.title: Great Seat But the Key is too hard to Turn! :(
customer_reviews.text: I really like this car seat but unfortunately will be returning it. The round key for the click tight feature is too hard to turn! My parents can never get it out (they're in their 70's). If you have someone whos fingers arent that strong i wouldn't recommend this seat... Sometimes I even have a hard time turning the key. Its too small and in an awkward place :/ I know they changed the key feature in the new click tight one4life seats that are now out...so Im gonna go for that one and see how I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great seat
customer_reviews.text: We, and our son, love this seat. We bought it after reading reviews on how it exceeds NHTSA safety standards. You can adjust the incline, so my 9 month old LOVEs being able to see out the window but he can still sleep in it without head slump. Recently he got pouch all over it and we were able to wipe it clean with Lysol wipes. The 5 point harness is easy to secure and tighten. I did a ton of research and am so glad we picked this seat. Our cousins son recently figured out how to loosen the straps on his extend2fit, so she got this as a replacement and is also happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly mom

customer_reviews.title: BRITAX ADVOCATE CLICKTIGHT LEXUS RX 2017
customer_reviews.text: We just got this convertible car seat for our 10 month old baby, first impressions:1. it is very spacious, my son weight 11kg and is 75cm long and he still has a lot of room left with his two arm inside, 2. the car seat is wide, but it fits very well in our car (Lexus Rx 2017), their is still a lot of room for two adults at each side of the car seat install and the middle of the back roll of the car, actually you can still recline the back seat, 3. To easy to install, it took. Me les. Than one minute to install this car seat the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Manufactured 1.5 years ago
customer_reviews.text: I'm bummed that I didn't see the manufacture date was 12/17 until after we already started using it. Our plan is to hopefully use this for 2 kids so losing this time on the expiration date is annoying. The carseat itself is pretty good, probably 4 stars. I like that it is washable, easy to install (as long as you don't over tighten the straps before closing the seat and clicktight function), and seems comfortable. Sometimes the chest harness clip can be a little finicky and the button to loosen the straps is a bit awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Baby can’t see anything!
customer_reviews.text: I did LOADS of research before splurging on this seat. The safety features are top of the line which is why I chose it. However, I dislike how far out the sides go. My daughter is unable to look out the window or really see anything at all. She just seems uncomfortable in it. Obviously safety should come before comfort but I’m contemplating returning this seat for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Aly Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Favorite car seat
customer_reviews.text: Love Britax car seats. This is our second Boulevard Clicktight as we have one for our toddler and one for the baby. Easy to install and use. Started using it with our 7 month old although it will work for a much smaller baby, and we are planning to keep using this seat for many years. The black fabric doesn’t get hot even on summer days. The biggest downfall is moving it between cars or for airport travel as the metal frame makes this heavy and bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Smith

customer_reviews.title: No chemical flame retardant, easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad for the safewash fabric, free of added chemical flame retardants! I like that the straps can tuck in the slots when baby is not in the car seat, so you don’t have to fish behind his back to get the straps out. It is a bit odd to stick my finger in to release the straps compared to our old Chicco, but I guess a kid can’t accidentally undo it. So easy to install!
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: The best and safest in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. I have one is my car and now one for my wifes car. I am super safety dad so i did a bunch of research and ended up going with this car seat. There are other brands out there that have better marketing and better colors and more sleek designs for the car seat but all that doesnt equal safety.
customer_reviews.author: chaddy

customer_reviews.title: A bit bulky, but also sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third marathon we have bought. Takes up some space, but they seem safe and comfortable. The small hole in the front of the seat that has the button for adjusting, is a small treasure box for snacks and sand. Just a warning. You will have to take the seat out and turn it upside down to get anything out of there. Otherwise, easy to use and install. Gets very hot if car is parked in the sun. We cool them off with ice packs before putting kids in.
customer_reviews.author: Amm

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy if your child is a child.
customer_reviews.text: I am not happy with this car seat. It is a bugger to uninstall to clean the cover and then reinstall. It is heavy and awkward to carry, and the padding is so cheaply affixed to the base. I am just so disappointed. The foam padding breaks away from the base and you can’t reattach it because the cover is supposed to slip between the foam and the base. I do feel it’s safe, but it’s not worth all the extra money. Cleaning this thing is just the worst.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Centarri

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Like most people, I can’t stand installing baby seats in my car. They’re always a hassle and you constantly worry that they aren’t installed correctly. This thing was an absolute breeze to install. Took just a few minutes to go from box to ready to use. My one issue is the location of the button to loosen the straps. I understand you don’t want it accessible to your child, but you have to stick your finger down a tiny hole at your child’s feet. My wife has small hands and finds it hard to reach the button at times.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Among the safest carseat with the easiest installation of all.
customer_reviews.text: This carseat is seriously awesome. The installation is seriously idiot proof. One of the biggest safety issues with carseats is their installation. Most of us simply don't install our little ones' carseats properly, even though we really try our best. I am one of those people who is always a bit uncertain. This removes all the guesswork and makes it unfussy and seriously easy. This carseat is heavy but so worth it for the ease of installation. On top of that, this is one of the few carseats with side protection and a very high safety rating. This has to be one of my best purchases and it was on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addict

customer_reviews.title: Bought again!
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd marathon. We bought the original one so it could fit into the backseat of a midsized pick up truck. Now that we no longer have that vehicle we did feel this was a very comfy seat and are getting another for a second vehicle. I got the blue since it was cheaper than the verve. The actual installation isn’t bad, however, it’s bulky so we prefer not to move from vehicle to vehicle (takes about 5-10min). The material is a little different so I’m going to keep an eye on breatheability on long trips but so far my kiddo loves it for around town.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, one of the best car seats out there
customer_reviews.text: Britax makes simply the best car seat in the market. The click tight just makes it easier to install and take off, transfer from car to car.
customer_reviews.author: Flora Wei

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to install and it is very stable. The last car seat I had never seemed to get tight enough to stay in place but this one doesn't budge. However, I got the mesh cloth that is supposed to keep my kid cooler but that is pretty much garbage. Even with the A/C blasting, she is almost always sweaty on her back. Don't spend the extra money for the "cooling" material.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria A. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Least favorite britax ever
customer_reviews.text: I've been a britax person for 12 years and multiple kids. I bought 2 of these for my kids and they are the most difficult carseat I have ever installed. In fact, they are so hard to install rear facing since the seat has to click down and friction occurs between the seat the car back, that I cannot even install them or remove them since I dont have the upper body strength. I was very disappointed. Also, this is the first carseat that my kids have complained about discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit but great seat
customer_reviews.text: We have a 2016 Toyota Corolla and it is a very tight fit in the middle back seat. It does push up against the back of the front seats a bit. My daughter doesn't fuss when in the seat and it seems to be quite comfortable for her. I haven't (thankfully!) been in an accident with it so I can't attest to the safety of it but it is very sturdy and well made and I feel very confident in its ability to keep my baby safe. I haven't had the issue with the anti rebound bar being loose. It fits veey snuggly and is sturdy in the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer P.

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Put baby in and chest clip was difficult but I got it- then when went to get him out it wouldn’t come open- screaming crying child and I had to lengthen straps to get him out, it’s stuck and if he were any bigger he would have been trapped in the seat in the car. Also, we have an infant seat by Britax that has much more comfortable straps - the plastic surrounding the straps make it much harder to shorten and didn’t look like baby was as comfortable as he was in his infant seat. Returning and picking something different entirely.
customer_reviews.author: PhillytoKeyWest

customer_reviews.title: Garbage Engineering
customer_reviews.text: This thing, compared to the Chicco NextFit Zip, is horrendous to install. The anchor clips use a simple pin system to lock the hook in place that is a pain to disengage. The band that the anchor hooks are on is IMPOSSIBLE to uncinch. I weigh 200 pounds and had to put my whole body weight into it to uncinch it. I'm a sweaty mess after installing this thing and now I have to box it up and send it back. We switch our seats between cars a lot and I'm not going through this again. Garbage engineering.
customer_reviews.author: Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I wanted something easy to install when I need to move it to another car. It is bulky/heavy, but still easy to install. We use the seatbelt in the back side seat (Honda Accord and Mazda 3) and middle (Ford F-150). Sturdy, seems comfortable, and easy to get kiddo in/out. I’ve only used it rear-facing so far. Also doesn’t seem to get too hot, even in Texas sun, but I have gotten the sun shade, just in case (still haven’t weathered the hottest days yet).
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Some drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: The installation is not as easy as they make it seem if you have the seatbelt pulled tight. I was only planning on buying one and changing them between cars but ended up having to buy another because of the installation. You definitely don’t want to have to do it every day. The other thing is when it’s installed you can’t change the recline position. That really bothers me. You have to un-install it just to recline it a little bit... Wish I knew these two things before buying. Other than that, it’s a good car seat I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safe seat, some annoying features
customer_reviews.text: The strap release button is awful (to loosen straps when getting kid out of seat), even worse than older model of carseat. The clicktight button is too prevalent for something you do not use everytime you put kid in/out of seat, but strap release is hidden. Grandparents cannot figure out this feature. Installation required a you tube video because instruction booklet is not clear enough. I HATE that the fabric is not machine washable. The carseat itself works fine. I feel like I can get kid in and strapped in safely. The kid doesn't complain about comfort. I have 2 of these plus an older model of this seat all in the second row of a Honda Odysseu.
customer_reviews.author: Darcie

customer_reviews.title: Best choice I've made!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I was dreading getting a new car seat, reading a new manual, & learning a new installation. Of course the manual was still forced, but the installation is the most secure ive ever gotten without spending 15 minutes trying to get it the tightest. The carseat is HEAVY, but no complaint there being that it's the safety item that may save my childs life🤷🏻‍♀️ the clicktight is SO EASY and fast to install. I am very happy that I chose this seat for my sons primary car seat. We love it so much! No more bickering with the hubby on what he thinks is proper installation too!
customer_reviews.author: Dawnrae Linn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got a good warehouse deal, and the baby now has the absolute most comfortable seat in the car. ** Update: Never could get the bounce bar to fit correctly - I finally stopped using it when my son was winding his feet under it. His feet would then take the full impact of an accident? No thanks - took the bar off, still a great seat. However, took the cover completely off for washing - and the foam behind his head is almost in 3 pieces! We are going to use our second car seat while I try to get ahold of the company for a new piece. We have never been in an accident.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy M

customer_reviews.title: Jammed tilt mechanism
customer_reviews.text: Jammed tilt mechanism from first install- too bad because i wanted to love this
customer_reviews.author: mw

customer_reviews.title: Superior in all categories
customer_reviews.text: Safety features and all-around ratings are some of the highest on NHTSA website. They have steel bars built into the frame, which makes the seat heavier, but superior in safety (worth it to me, an emergency physician). I appreciate the ease of installation and several features that ensure you are installing the seat correctly (because a surprisingly high percentage of car seats are installed incorrectly). Well-priced here compared to stores (even with a 20% store coupon).
customer_reviews.author: Heidi K.

customer_reviews.title: Bought a second because this one is so great
customer_reviews.text: Overall an awesome carseat. Looks great, kiddo appears happy riding in it, functionality is spot on. PROS 1. Great Color 2. Love the seat saving mat 3. The chest buckle fits well, great rubber protectors 4. The gage on the side is easy to read and informative 5. Padding is superior 6. Easy to clean CONS 1. The neck strap cushions are awkward and do not stay in place
customer_reviews.author: Walruseen

customer_reviews.title: Not a good seat for boys.
customer_reviews.text: I love how securely this car seat fits. It doesn’t wiggle at all! The sad parts- the fabric cover does not stay put. Also the buckle at the crotch is so poorly placed... my son is a small 3 year old and it is extremely uncomfortable for him. To the point where we took him to the doctors because he was so sore down below... we were afraid something was wrong... then we discovered it was his car seat that was causing him pain! This seat has great potential- but it has kinks that need to be ironed out.
customer_reviews.author: I can see clearly now...

customer_reviews.title: Good seat.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install with the included LATCH anchor strap, and holds tight. I do wish it was the quick-release type, but I shouldn't be taking the seat out a lot. Some of the visible fabric seems permanently attached, so it won't be easy to clean. Our old Britax, the cloth cover pulled off easy to clean, which was nice. I also wish the plastic were a dark color so it didn't stick out so much when the van door is open. Kinda looks like a medical apparatus with all that white/light grey. So I guess most of my complaints are basically visual.
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: Head on collision, baby unscathed.
customer_reviews.text: In the middle of December a car crossed the median and hit us head on. I had some injuries, but my son was completely unharmed. We cut the straps after the accident and immediately bought the exact same model and print.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Alliah Stout

customer_reviews.title: Not safe!!  Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: Outwardly it looked OK including the box. After setting the car seat on cement porch the car seat was crooked. Further inspection indicated the frame had been crushed and reboxed. Any simple fender bender could have severally hurt the child. Forget Social responsiblity and "we are safely this together" is clearly out the window for profit. So disappointed in Britax and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Nickerson

customer_reviews.title: Really great, except for one thing...
customer_reviews.text: This car seat is a tank! I definitely feel like my daughter is secure in it. It was very easy to install with the ClickTight. My main issue comes with the strap to pull the harness tight. It's very difficult to do this when the car seat is rear facing. And I have to do it several times because the straps do not tighten all the way (I can pinch them on the shoulders and around the waist!). I am hoping this will be easier when she eventually moves to forward facing, but I am definitely disappointed with it at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Alec

customer_reviews.title: Restore your sanity and get Clicktight car seats
customer_reviews.text: Want a car seat that will keep you from becoming enraged when you need to take it in and out? This is the one for you! All the car seats we used before discovering Britax Clicktight made my blood boil and felt like a cruel joke. These honestly take two minutes max with ZERO cursing or screaming!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Britax is the way to go!
customer_reviews.text: I have researched and reviewed tons of different carseats over the last six years of being a parent. I belong to a few groups online for carseat safety as well. We will always choose Britax seats for their comfort, ease of use, great ratings, and overall peace of mind for safety. I also love that each model has a range of patterns - currently our youngest and oldest have two different model seats with the same pattern and the boys think it's just the coolest. Our daughter has the same seat as the oldest but in a different pattern that's "more her style".
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, heavy and comfy
customer_reviews.text: They is heavy!!!!! It's about 30-40 pounds heavy which makes me feel like my baby is in a safe box. The button to pull the straps is easy to get to, hidden but large enough for fingers to find. Looked like a beast to put together but it was actually very easy. When you wash be sure to place be itself and in delicate cycle. The fabric tends to snag. Pictures are actually taken after the first wash as my baby gets motion sickness often. Need to adjust height? No need to dismantle and disassemble, just push and pull the red tab on top and easily adjusted!!!! Room to grow! No cup holder but really don't mind that.
customer_reviews.author: IRIS C CHECOCRUZTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I would return but got on sale at Christmas and missed return window.
customer_reviews.text: I assumed with britax I would get the click latch system but got the cheaper hook system. I also used both the seat belt and the latch system but could not get the car seat as tight even with the help of my husband and it still moves more then my oldest daughter's. I would return but we got this on sale at Christmas and we used a infant travel system until now. I would recommend emblem since it seems more like my old car seat.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Tuggle

customer_reviews.title: Very nice car seat
customer_reviews.text: High quality product. Very safety oriented product. Has a multitude of adjustments for safety, direction, age, comfort. Anchoring uses existing seat belt with a unique system to tighten and cinch the seat belt for a tight fit. Ordered the optional cup holder, but it turned out to be useless due to poor design. Check my review on the cup holder for details.
customer_reviews.author: C. Locke

customer_reviews.title: Great! Bought it twice!
customer_reviews.text: Caught this carseat on a black Friday mark down, this is the second time we purchased this carseat and will repurchase if we need another. My toddler is comfy in this, he moved into it when he was too long for the infant carseat and he'll be good for forward facing this year in this seat. Washes in the washing machine well, I put the pieces in a lingere bag and washed on delicate with tide powder with no issues. Toddler doesn't seem to overheat with the Coolmax fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetalkin' Hippie

customer_reviews.title: Love my Britax!
customer_reviews.text: So with my first child I wasn't sure what brand to get and I settled on a Britax for my car while my husband got a Graco. I find the Britax super easy to install (after a couple times doing it) and while it doesn't have cupholders like the Graco it seems much more comfortable for my son. I am happy it's so highly rated for it's safety that it's worth the money to me.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Dimberio

customer_reviews.title: Is NOT for a 5lb baby! Be aware.
customer_reviews.text: This does not seem to fit a 5lb baby. My son is 6 lbs and I cannot get the straps small enough for him to be secure. That side plastic pieces on the straps are to big and push up against his face. I have the straps as tight as they go. I can still fit my hand probably both hands in the space between the buckles and my sons chest. That’s how much extra space is there. We just don’t go anywhere. I’m scared to take him out in that seat. Hopefully he’ll grow into it.
customer_reviews.author: P and K Young

customer_reviews.title: Best option for a child who figures things out
customer_reviews.text: Love love love that my son can't reach with his lil fingers the release button to the straps. On our previous cast seat he was able to loosen the straps and remove his arms. With the button being tucked further away makes it better for little fingers to not reach which in my opinion is a win win situation.
customer_reviews.author: Gary & Nichole Salatino

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, adjustable positions
customer_reviews.text: This is for our second child as the first one used a cheapo Cosco seat. The install is quick for rear facing. There are several positions that can be used. It fit without issue in our 3 Series BMW (midsize sedan), but had to use a window seat with the other carseat installed. On a bigger vehicle you could probably fit it in the middle seat. Overall happy with Britax for the past 3 years on all of their products which we are still using today. Great quality USA products.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Nothing works easily. Not suited for small child (my baby was ...
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to use in my opinion. Nothing works easily. Not suited for small child (my baby was 4mo when we tried this and it seemed uncomfortable for her). Returned!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid as rock! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I am convinced my son would be fine if shot out of a cannon in this seat. I have bought so many car seats for my kids over the years, but finally bought a Britax for the first time. It is soo heavy from the steel frame, but I find this to be a good thing. My 18 month old loves it- he look like a little race car driver. I will only buy Britax from here on out!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gray

customer_reviews.title: Highest quality car seats
customer_reviews.text: Personally, I think Britax is the sturdiest, highest quality car seat on the market. The fabric keeps kids comfortable and cool, and the padding is supportive and lasting. My only complaint is that my kids were able to reach the button that loosens the straps! These were a replacement after a fender bender, and our old car seats had the button way out of children’s reach. I had to have a long talk with my kids about not pushing that button, ever. Britax - please make this button unreachable to the passengers!!
customer_reviews.author: dpetersen

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought this car seat because of its high crash test ratings and because Britax has a great reputation. However, I find the strap system awkward. There are rubber grips on the straps for extra safety but they make adjusting the straps on my child a bit difficult. Also sometimes it seems the lock tight system doesn’t make the clicking sound it is supposed to when the proper tightness is reached. I probably would not buy this brand again.

customer_reviews.title: Not user-friendly at all
customer_reviews.text: I transitioned my 17 month old petite baby from a Britax infant car seat to this car seat. I love the brand so I thought I would be super happy with it. I was incredibly wrong. She absolutely could not take a nap in it and it's hell to install and uninstall. Getting the seat to reach different incline and recline positions is also hell. I still love Britax brand but unfortunately would have to give this car seat only two stars because of how inconvenient it is and how uncomfortable the baby is if he or she happens to want to take a nap in the car seat while you are on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi McCreight

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter for my truck. She outgrew the infant seat and we went with Britax. My wife has the Nuna, which was more expensive. I actually prefer this one to it. The Britax is easy and more intuitive to install and operate. There is also a little more space and the britax seems more comfortable for my daughter. She'll fall asleep in the Britax, not so much in the Nuna. I would definitely buy the Britax again.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: The Click tight Pins Don't Release Correctly on 3 different Car Seats
customer_reviews.text: This is now our third car seat where the pins from the click tight mechanism do not release and need to manually be released with a key or some other small object. We first called into Britax (which I'd like to note has some of the most unhelpful customer service hours) and they sent us a new car seat. The replacement had the same issue. We bought another for my car, and it too has an issue. I'm still in the process of trying to resolve this with them. This would be a great product if it worked consistently. Unfortunately, from our experience it doesn't work more often than it does.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Rice

customer_reviews.title: Best Car Seat we’ve tried
customer_reviews.text: My baby hated the car. Myself and our children were crying along with her whenever we had to put her in our Orbit seat. This seat is a game changer. She hardly cries now unless she has good reason. It’s so easy to install and so easy to get her in and out of the seat. The angle is so nice for her and it’s open enough for her to see her siblings and not feel like she’s lost in a bucket. It is so well padded I’m confident in the safety as well. Now I know why so many friends recommended this seat! We’ve had Graco seats, Cosco seatsand Orbit and this Is hands down the best.
customer_reviews.author: Jacs

customer_reviews.title: The Beast of car seats
customer_reviews.text: This beast of a car seat is amazing. I can’t believe I had my daughter in one of those cheap Graco infant carriers. When I strap my daughter in, I know that she will be as safe as can be. It’s easy to install and super easy to strap her in (She’s 6 months old). Best of all, she’s comfortable in it. I had some issues with the recline lever (it broke) but I called Britax and they sent a replacement seat within 3 days. They made a customer for life with their incredible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne McCormack

customer_reviews.title: 4th click tight in our family
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th click tight car seat I’ve purchased. The design seems identical to the ones I purchased a few years ago. However, The most recently purchased seat was labeled “Made in the USA” while the other seats were manufactured in China. The new seat belt adjusts more smoothly then my other click tight seats... overall I suspect this newer seat went through better quality controls as it just seems like it has been better made.
customer_reviews.author: Angoraknitter

customer_reviews.title: Beware! Broken foam in less than 2 years
customer_reviews.text: The head rest "energy-absorbing" (polystyrene) foam broke in less than 2 years. Cost of replacement is $15 + $5 S&H. This car seat is supposed to last until the child is 65lb (9.5 years old on average, per growth charts). It is disappointing and unacceptable to have that important part broken for the remainder of the car seat's lifetime. The car seat is also extremely heavy, making it an annoyance when there is a need to switch cars.
customer_reviews.author: Crbrus

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to install without superhuman strength
customer_reviews.text: This carseat ranks pretty high in terms of safety, but pushing the seat down to properly engage the Click Tight feature is nearly impossible. It takes the strength of multiple people. I recommend a brand of carseat that uses latch anchors (Graco) or a traditional lock off (Cybex) if you will need to remove the seat (for cleaning, etc) and install multiple times. I would never buy this model again.
customer_reviews.author: nycrinne

customer_reviews.title: Amazing carseat with simple installation!
customer_reviews.text: This carseats is fantastic! The instructions are simple and concise. Both adjustment and installation are extremely simple! If you ever used any other carseats, you'll know that installation can be a task, but not with Britax's Clicktight! Fastening our child into the seat is very easy, and offers plenty of comfort. Even though we purchased for our youngest, It fits a wide range and could be used for any of our children. We are more than satisfied, and remain very happy Britax users!
customer_reviews.author: David A.

customer_reviews.title: Great seat for larger car
customer_reviews.text: So far we love this cart seat and so does my daughter (7 months). It was very easy to install and is much easier to get her in and out of than her infant car seat was. It's seems very safe, too. However, the seat itself barely fits in my car (Chevy Trax, a small SUV) due to the height of the seat and the recline position needed when rear-facing for her age. If you have a smaller car and plan to use this seat rear-facing for a young infant/toddler, it is probably a not an option.
customer_reviews.author: AmLomb13

customer_reviews.title: Nice but cramped
customer_reviews.text: My ONLY issue with this carseat is there is not much legroom in rear-facing mode. We also tried out the Graco Extend2fit and the Clek fllo and ended up choosing the Clek. Rear-facing for as long as possible is extremely important to me and ultimately I felt my daughter would be more comfortable in a seat that gave her more legroom. For comparison, my Chicco Nextfit infant carseat gave more legroom than this did. My daughter is only 30%ile for height and her feet already touched the seat using this one. It is otherwise comfortable, VERY easy to use and very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent car seat!
customer_reviews.text: We love this car seat and our son loves it too! It’s definitely on the bulkier side but very comfortable for baby and has great safety features! Love the flame retardant free material- that was important to me and was willing to pay a little more for it. Was very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Adjusting recline is a pain, but otherwise great seat
customer_reviews.text: We really like the seat, something I've noticed is that it is a little difficult to adjust recline. The plastic handle parts you use to adjust are more cheaply made and difficult to use than the rest of the seat which is almost foolproof. The seat is meant to be bulky for protection so keep that in mind if you're driving a smaller sized car. Aside from difficulty getting the seat adjusted correctly, it was easy to install and appears to be comfortable and moderately durable by design. We have two and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Easiest install around
customer_reviews.text: Refreshingly easy to install. I bought this for my mom, who watches my son several days a week. I noticed that she would frequently take our infant carseat base out of her car (Chicco keyfit), and wanted to make sure that she had a convertible that was just as easy to take in and out. This carseat is a beast in terms of weight, but the clicktight really cannot be beat. I now wish that I had bought one of these for myself (I have a Chicco nextfit- and even with the super cinch LATCH it is not as easy to install).
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Toto

customer_reviews.title: The best car seat
customer_reviews.text: As a small woman - installing a car seat can be difficult. This car seat makes it easy to install a car seat on my own! The durability of this car seat gives me peace of mine that my babies are safe while we are driving. The seat is easy to wipe clean with a baby wipe and I use my car handheld vacuum to clean in the creases where food crumbs are left. Highly recommend this car seat!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Big and safe.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is quite big, so if you have limited space in your car be aware that it is going to crowd the seat in front of it. We drive a small SUV and when it is installed in rear-facing mode (for smaller toddlers) it's a bit of a space hog. However, it is VERY easy to install and remove, and it seems very safe and stable. My little one seems to find it very comfortable, even on a multi-state road trip. Overall, I am very happy that we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Zoo

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and comfort
customer_reviews.text: We love this car seat for our 20 month old daughter. We also have the graco extend 2 fit as a second/spare seat. Overall the quality of this seat is higher, and she’s more comfortable. The only thing I will say is that the graco has more leg room for taller kids. Installation is easy! It’s a little heavy, but when you do need to switch to another car the clicktight is by far the one I would rather move! Overall very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: HMagnan

customer_reviews.title: Best Choice We Made
customer_reviews.text: This is the best choice we made for a carseat. We also have a doona that is convenient for travel, but this carseat is the best. Its comfortable and soft, and leans back and my baby never cries in it! SHe just loves it, It is super easy to remove and install incase the grandparents need to borrow it. I feel like my daughter is super secure when inside and the straps are comfortable and dont cut into her, and we've been able to adjust the height of it easily over time as she grows. By far our favorite choice in seats!
customer_reviews.author: Chaz Eckenrod

customer_reviews.title: Waist of money
customer_reviews.text: So so disappointed. Within 4 months the foam head rest snapped in half and the recline mechanism is a constant fight to get it reclined and that handle has broken of multiple times will trying to adjust it. The click tight feature is great for installation but safety and functionality are very poor in my opinion. Never again will I spend my money on a Britax seat.
customer_reviews.author: Carter Dwight

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied so far
customer_reviews.text: My baby was so whining when she sots in a baby carseat even she was small enough to fit in. So I decide tried out her sit in the the advocate carseat when she was 5 months. Very satisfied so far. She got very well sleep and easy to put her in and out. Even easy to install with just open the carseat with a ted button. But in Texas summer weather, she got all wet in her back when she sit for few minutes. Otherwise, I love the quality. Recommend to buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Jiyeon

customer_reviews.title: My most favorite Britax to date
customer_reviews.text: My most favorite Britax to date! I've owned 7 Britax car seats over the years between 4 kids and the technology just keeps getting better! Love the click-tight, it really makes installation so easy and simple!! Especially in older vehicles or middle row captains seats that don't have the anchor latches like my '03 GMC Yukon DenaliXL. I would definitely recommend this car seat!!
customer_reviews.author: Monica Doster

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install, straps could be better
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy to install compared to other seats we have had and is nicely padded. The only reason I did not give 5 stars is the buckle is not as nice as some others. It can be a little hard to buckle and get right. Not impossible, just not as nice in my opinion as some others. But overall this is a great buy. I am currently using for my very tall and chunky 10 month old for reference. He seems to like it!
customer_reviews.author: Pava1913

customer_reviews.title: Best Carseat Ever
customer_reviews.text: Best convertible seat I've ever owned. In the past, if I had to consider letting someone borrow my car seat so they could take my kid somewhere I opted for no, 90% of the time because it was such a hassle. This thing literally pops out And pops back in. Takes like 2 min to install. Love it. Plus, kiddo says it's comfy and I feel like she's really safe in it. It's SOLID once you have the clicktight in place. Like, it doesn't even move a centimeter. It's rock solid. Just what I was looking for. Best coupled with the Britax seat protectors.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Favorite car seat
customer_reviews.text: When looking for a car seat safety is important. I love our Britax marathon car seat. This seat is durable, easy to install, and easy to clean. We will definitely be buying another one for our newest addition. My only complaint is you have to lift the seat in order to adjust the straps. With Ohio's inconsistent weather I'm needing to adjust the straps frequently. So this can become annoying. We also purchased the open box car seat for a cheaper price and it came in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to clean!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s Heavy!!!!... because of the steel frame. One of the best car seats out there BUT my daughter threw up and the straps aren’t removable 😫🤬 if I would have known the straps weren’t removable, I would have looked for a different one!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The better of our 2 car seats
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a Graco Extend2Fit for our other car, and I was initially wondering why I spent so much more on the Britax. But after a month of using both, it's obvious that our 9 month old is more comfortable in the Britax & I find it SO much easier to get him into compared to the Graco. I really love the click when the harness is appropriately tightening because I never feel confident that I have it right.
customer_reviews.author: jessklo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, very solid and dont move much once installed
customer_reviews.text: The click tight technology really makes it easy to install them easily between cars. Not only easy it feels more solid and dont move much once installed, if done correctly of course. Safety is definitely the top priority for parents and i feel safe putting my kids in these car seats. We had the Britax model before this model, we were involved in a car wreck that ended up in a total loss and both my kids where fine. Easy to take certain pieces off to throw it in a washer. Multiple adjustable positions. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Theo

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Love this carseat! We took it to California to visit my in laws. We flew and was able to check it just fine (yes it was heavy to lug around but that was okay). We ended up getting into a 9 car pileup and we were in the middle. The carseat did its thing and kept my 1 year old safe. We plan on replacing this one do to the wreck and we will be getting another one.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Winner
customer_reviews.text: I did extensive/head spinning research before deciding on this seat. I wanted the best in safety and quality. The materials seem to be top notch and my son is so comfortable. It fits rear facing in my Subaru Forester wonderfully. The air cool fabric has seemed to help in the swealtering southern summer. Installation is a breeze and I feel comfortable installing it in any car if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Layla

customer_reviews.title: Harness release button jammed immediately
customer_reviews.text: It has great safety ratings and looks sleek. Unfortunately, the harness release button jammed immediately and we were never able to loosen the straps. Harness release button is also inaccessible if you have short fingers. Returned it and bought a Clek Foonf instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jean M. Payton

customer_reviews.title: don't buy
customer_reviews.text: within two months, it would not work. would not release seatbelt or seat. had to cut and basically disassemble seat. we did get a pinnacle for a different car, which works great. I really wish I could return this expensive broken car seat for another pinnacle.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Schrader

product_meta.title: Britax Boulevard ClickTight Convertible Car Seat | 2 Layer Impact Protection - Rear & Forward Facing - 5 to 65 Pounds, Circa
product_meta.description: Color:Circa| Style:2 Layer Impact ProtectionThe boulevard click tight convertible car seat has the patented click tight installation system, an extra layer of side impact protection, click & safe snug harness indicator, and safe cell impact protection for peace of mind while you are on the go with your child. Car seat installation is easy as buckling a seat-belt thanks to the click tight installation system. In the boulevard car seat, you are surrounded in safety. This convertible car seat features the patented Britax safe cell impact protection system, which includes a steel frame, energy-absorbing base, v shaped tether to minimize seat rotation and staged release stitches that slow and reduce forward movement in the event of a crash. Britax designed the boulevard click tight car seat with 2 strong layers of side energy absorption; a deep foam lined shell and head protection will shield your child from side impacts. Plush foam padding and fabric, along with 7 recline positions ensures premium comfort for your child. The 14 position easy adjust harness grows along with your child and you can change the height of the seat with just the push of a button no re-threading necessary. Have peace of mind knowing your child's harness is within range of proper tightness. With the sound of a click thanks to the click & safe snug harness indicator, you will know it is correctly adjusted. The boulevard car seat can be used rear facing 5 40 pounds and forward facing 20 65 pounds, child standing height 49 inches or less. Car seat dimensions 23 x 18.5 x 23.5 inches (LxWxH). 14 position harness slot heights 8.35 inches to 19.4 inches. FAA approved. Seat area depth / width: 10.5 / 11.5 inches. Recommendation: the American academy of pediatrics recommends that all infants and toddlers should ride in a rear facing car seat until they are 2 years of age or until they reach the highest weight or height allowed by their car seat manufacturer. Britax strongly recommends that children ride rear facing to the highest weight or height specified.
feature_bullets: Easy installation: patented click tight makes car seat installation as simple as buckling a seat belt
No rethreading, ever: quick adjust 14 position harness with click and safe snug indicator gives a click sound when the harness is tight
Adjust accurately: harness indicator gives an audible click when you’ve pulled to the proper tightness
Surrounded in safety: 2 layers of side impact protection, steel frame and impact absorbing base
Fits: rear facing 5 to 40 pounds and forward facing 20 to 65 pounds; dimensions: 23 x 18.5 x 23.5 inches (LxWxH)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars3,062 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
